title: Patch problem...
content:
I'm trying to add patches to my mod. So far, I have four patches. The invincibility message patch, the free stuff message patch, the color patch, and the "always have pogo" patch. But only The invincibility message patch and the free stuff message patch are working.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] How come?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] -------------------

title: Re: Patch problem...
content:
Next time post at K:M.

Um...

1. Is the "%version 1.31" (or whatever the command is) in it? If so try taking it out.

2. Are the patches after the "%ext ck1" but before "%end"? Ther should be.-Genius314

title: Re: Patch problem...
content:
I did do %version 1.31 and the patches are after %ext ck1 but before %end. But the colors are still exactly the same and Keen still doesn't start out with his pogo.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] what should I do?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] -------------------

content: take out the "%version 1.31" and check if you're game's version is 1.31. If it 1.0, then you need to download 1.31.-Genius314

title: Re: Patch problem...
content: And are you sure you run "ck1patch yourpatchfile.pat"?You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Patch problem...
content:
The file name is 1keen131, which means that the version I am using (most likely) is version 1.31. Also, I typed "ck1patch Harvey.pat" (Harvey.pat is the pat file I am using) but Keen doesn't start with his pogo, nor are the colors changed. I've used Patchotron to make the patches, maybe I need use ck1patch instead?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] -------------------

title: Re: Patch problem...
content: ck1patch doesn't make patches. It just runs them. Its best to use notepad to edit patch files, though.-Genius314

title: Re: Patch problem...
content:
^ Fully agree with that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Hmmm, well, can't think of anything else what could be wrong. Are you sure you have unlzexed your Keen exe? (Probably you have, since otherwise ck1patch wouldn't start up.) Show use the patch file you're using, then, maybe we can find something wrong in there.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

Harvey, what's this topic doing in "Official Keen Games" instead of Keen:Modding? At least post in "Other Keen Stuff" or "Unofficial Keen Games." Mods are not official Keen games!

You need a Batch file to tell CK1Patch to use your .PAT file. Check any existing mod to see how it's done. :-)

title: Re: ...
content: Post the exact text that is in the patchfile. (From start to finish, including %ext, %version and %end)

title: Re: ...
content:
%ext ck1

%version 1.31

%dump Harvey.txt

#Invincibility mode
%patch 0x01500A "Invincibility!!!"
%patch 0x01501B "Vincibility... "

#CTSpace
%patch 0x014F02 "You are now cheating!"
%patch 0x014F19 "You just got all of the "
%patch 0x014F35 "key cards, and tons of"
%patch 0x014F4D "ray gun charges! "

%patch $13054
00 00 00
00 00 42
00 42 00
00 42 42
42 00 00
42 00 42
42 42 00
42 42 42
21 21 21
21 21 63
21 63 21
21 63 63
63 21 21
63 21 63
63 63 21
63 63 63

#Always have pogo
%patch $900E $01 $00

%end-------------------

content:

Try unloading your TSRs!" and at the bottem left of the window, weird simbols and a strange message were showen.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] So I decided that I should put the "version 1.31" back in. The color patch and the "always have pogo" patches still didn't work.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] So what could possibly be wrong with my patches?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] -------------------

title: grr argh growl
content:
Harvey, you've been changing addresses. Your patch file won't work because you're patching things to the wrong place. Check this out:

[hr]
God Mode messages:

Harvey's code:
%patch 0x01500A "Invincibility!!!"
%patch 0x01501B "Vincibility... "

Proper code:
%patch $14EF6 "Invincibility!!!"
%patch $14F07 "Vincibility... "

You changed the addresses on this! They're supposed to be in the late 14000's block, not the early 15000's block!

[hr]
CtSpace Cheat message:

Harvey's code:
%patch 0x014F02 "You are now cheating!"
%patch 0x014F19 "You just got all of the "
%patch 0x014F35 "key cards, and tons of"
%patch 0x014F4D "ray gun charges! "

Proper code:
%patch 0x014DEE "You are now cheating!"
%patch 0x014E05 "You just got all of the "
%patch 0x014E21 "keycards, and tons of"
%patch 0x014E39 "ray gun charges! "

Again, you changed these addresses and moved them later in the code--they're supposed to be in the 14E00's, not the 14F00's.

[hr]
Palette changing patches:

Harvey's code:
%patch $13054
00 00 00
00 00 42
00 42 00
00 42 42
42 00 00
42 00 42
42 42 00
42 42 42
21 21 21
21 21 63
21 63 21
21 63 63
63 21 21
63 21 63
63 63 21
63 63 63

Proper code:
# This is the color palette: 16 entries of r, g, b (each 0-63)
%patch $13054
00 00 00
00 00 42
00 42 00
00 42 42
42 00 00
42 00 42
42 42 00
42 42 42
21 21 21
21 21 63
21 63 21
21 63 63
63 21 21
63 21 63
63 63 21
63 63 63

# Set the palette when we go into graphics mode
%patch $6E46 $E8 $D3 $D5 $90 $90

# Code to set graphics mode and set the palette
%patch $441C $B8 $0D $00 $CD
$10 $B8 $12 $10 $B9 $08 $00 $BB
$00 $00 $8C $DA $8E $C2 $BA $04
$00 $CD $10 $BB $18 $00 $BA $1C
$00 $CD $10 $C3

# Include this part if the "Change background tiles" patch is not used
# It gives us 36 spare bytes for the palette-setting code
%patch $4409 $B8 $14 $01 $26 $81 $3F $31
$01 $73 $03 $B8 $8F $00 $26 $89
$07 $E9 $5C $01

You forgot all the technical patchwork which allows your changed palette to even run! :-(

[hr]
Always have pogo:

Harvey's code:
%patch $900E $01 $00

Proper code:
%patch $900E $01 $00

Hehe--you got this one right. Good job. :-)

[hr]

As you can see, Harvey, you forgot to include half of the Palette change patch, and you also somehow changed the addresses for the God Mode and CTSpace cheat messages--they crashed my copy of Keen when I tried to run them!

Make sure you're UnLzExe'ing your files, make sure you're opening your Harvey.txt dump file in a HEX editor, and make sure you're patching to the correct offsets. Something was very wrong with your patch file.

title: Re: grr argh growl
content: Wait.. so the "0x0whatever" is just like putting "$whatever" except that $ gets replaced with 0x0? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img] -Genius314

title: correct
content: I didn't learn so until just recently, but that is correct.

title: Here...
content:
[url=http://dosclassics.com/download/200]here[/url]

Just open the file you made with the %dump command and look up addresses with it.
The address is the four-digit hexadecimal number in the bottom left corner when you click on a character.-Genius314
